data.name: [SFDC-1154] Fix Contract Selection for Veriforce vs PEC Scheduled Job
data.notes:
Summary
A scheduled Apex job is selecting contracts across both Veriforce and PEC due to naming and/or selection logic issues, instead of targeting the intended company. The job must reliably filter to the correct company context to prevent incorrect processing. Client ID: 248269.

Value or Impact

    Prevents mis-selection of contracts that could impact billing or service accuracy for 500+ external customers.
    Reduces reputational and client experience risk by ensuring data integrity across partners (Veriforce and PEC).
    Protects revenue by avoiding downstream processing errors.

Acceptance Criteria

    The scheduled job selects only the correct company’s contracts (Veriforce or PEC) based on the intended company context.
    No contracts from the other company are selected, processed, or updated when the job runs.
    Job naming and referenced identifiers follow an approved convention that disambiguates between Veriforce and PEC runs.
    A test run (or logs) demonstrates expected record counts for the targeted company and zero unintended selections.
    No regressions observed for other customers or contract processes.

Technical Details

    Update the scheduled job’s naming convention and/or selector logic used to determine Veriforce vs. PEC contract sets.
    Confirm which field(s) or attribute(s) in Salesforce distinguish the company context used by the job. (Information not provided.)
    Validate the SOQL query/selection logic to ensure it filters only the intended company’s contracts.
    Ensure the change is applied to the correct scheduled job instance referenced by the current “CRON” naming.
    Client context: Client ID 248269.
    Reference: SFDC-1154.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Apex Scheduled Job (CRON) responsible for contract selection.
    Salesforce contract selection/query logic and related Contract records.

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Confirm whether this ticket is still needed or was mis-routed due to “CRON” terminology. https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672 to validate scope/need per question from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209127958101691.
    Identify the exact scheduled job name and the location of the selection logic.
    Verify which field distinguishes Veriforce vs. PEC in the selection filter.
    Reproduce current behavior against Client ID 248269 and validate fix with targeted test runs.
    Lift variance noted historically (45 vs. ~90 min). Current Lift is 45m; re-confirm once scope is validated.

data.name: [SFDC-530] Improve shipping validation error specificity
data.notes:
Summary
The Fulfillment team needs more specific error messages when shipping validation fails in Salesforce. Currently, validation errors are too vague, making it difficult to identify which required fields are missing or invalid. This enhancement will update the error messaging to explicitly enumerate each missing or invalid field required to mark shipments as "Ready to Ship."

Value or Impact
This improvement will significantly enhance the user experience for the Fulfillment department (2-9 users), reducing time spent troubleshooting shipping errors and decreasing support requests. By providing clear, actionable error messages, users can quickly resolve issues and process shipments more efficiently, directly impacting operational productivity and reducing friction in daily workflows.

Acceptance Criteria
• Error messages explicitly list each missing or invalid required field when shipping validation fails
• Specific field names appear in the error message at validation time, visible without inspecting logs
• No new Salesforce fields are introduced as part of this change
• Validation passes silently when all required shipping fields are properly completed
• Solution tested on existing Order record (801Ub00000XFVtyIAH) and one new test Order
• Error messages display in a consistent, readable format aligned with "Ready to Ship" requirements

Technical Details
The implementation will update the validation logic within the Shipping details workflow for Orders. This involves modifying the existing error handling mechanism (likely validation rules, Flow, or Apex triggers) to enumerate specific field failures rather than displaying generic messages. The solution must integrate with the current Lightning component UI that surfaces these errors during the shipping entry process.

Affected Systems
• Salesforce Order object - Shipping details section and validation workflow
• Validation rules/Flow/Apex controlling "Ready to Ship" status gate
• Lightning components displaying shipping validation errors
• Integration points with fulfillment systems that rely on "Ready to Ship" status

Next Steps or Analyst Notes
Task confirmed as still needed by Ben Gores on Oct 7. Clarification received Oct 14: error appears as on-screen message during shipping entry, not on specific record pages. Implementation should focus on the exact UI component/flow step that emits the error. Note: SFDC Request field shows "Bug" but this is characterized as a Feature enhancement - consider field alignment.

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary
The Fulfillment team reports that when entering Shipping details in Salesforce, the error shown upon missing or invalid required inputs is vague. The request is to make the error messaging explicit, listing exactly which required fields are missing or invalid so users can efficiently mark shipments as "Ready to Ship."

Value

    Improves user experience and reduces rework for the Fulfillment team
    Speeds up shipment processing by clearly indicating required fields to resolve
    Reduces support back-and-forth and internal friction

Acceptance Criteria

    When Shipping details are incomplete or invalid, the error message lists each specific required field that must be completed or corrected to mark the shipment as "Ready to Ship."
    The message appears at the time of validation in the Shipping details workflow and is visible to the user without needing to inspect logs or hidden UI states.
    No new Salesforce fields are introduced as part of this change.
    Validation passes and no error is shown when all required Shipping fields are properly completed.
    Behavior validated on at least one real Order record (see Additional Context link) and one newly created test Order.

Technical Requirements

    Update the validation/error messaging logic invoked by the Shipping details workflow for Orders so that it enumerates missing/invalid required fields.
    No new fields or objects requested.
    Implementation should leverage existing Salesforce mechanisms used in the current Shipping validation (e.g., validation rules, Flow, Apex, or Lightning component messaging) consistent with current architecture; scope is limited to improving specificity of the message text and field references.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Order object (Shipping details section/workflow)
    Validation logic and/or Flow/Apex that gates setting "Ready to Ship"
    Any Lightning component or UI surface that displays Shipping validation errors for Orders

Triage Notes

    Request originated from Fulfillment; initially not needed for go-live (per comments on Jun 19), but requester confirmed on Oct 7 that it still needs to be fixed.
    Clarification: The error is surfaced as an on-screen error message during Shipping details entry, not on a specific record page like Quote/Opportunity/Invoice (per Oct 14 comment).
    Reproduce with provided record: https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Order/801Ub00000XFVtyIAH/view
    Confirm the exact UI component or flow step that emits the error to ensure message updates appear in the correct surface.
    Align fields list with the current definition of "Ready to Ship" requirements; enumerate those fields in the error in a consistent, readable format.
    Cross-functional: FULF (requirements confirmation) + TIE (implementation).
    Note: "SFDC Request" field currently shows "Bug" while the ticket type and description indicate a Feature; recommend aligning fields to "Feature."

Original Request Context (Preserved)

    Department: FULF - Fulfillment
    Impact: Entire Department or Team; 2–9 users
    Priority: Medium; not needed for initial go-live (original comment), but still needed per latest confirmation
    What to call this: "Specific requirements in Error message for shipping details"
    User Story: As a fulfillment team member, when entering Shipping details, the error message should state exactly which required fields are missing to mark the shipment as "Ready to Ship."

data.name: [SFDC-538] Populate Language field on products
data.notes:
Summary
Populate the existing Language field on Salesforce Product records for all current products across posters, kits, manuals, meetings, and MMS. This backfill enables accurate Fulfillment reporting and supports Fulfillment's go-live in Salesforce while ensuring no adverse impact to related objects or reporting.

Value or Impact

    Improves operational reporting accuracy for Fulfillment
    Reduces manual workarounds and risk of incorrect shipments/communications  
    Supports timely and consistent customer experience for 500+ impacted external customers

Acceptance Criteria

    Language field is populated for existing products in the following categories: posters, kits, manuals, meetings, and MMS
    No adverse impact to existing relationships, reporting, or other object dependencies
    Data migration executed in Sandbox first with validation before Production deployment
    Source data verified against provided Google Sheet mapping

Technical Details

    Data backfill of an existing field; no new fields or schema changes required
    Execute in Sandbox first; validate results, then promote to Production
    Source-of-truth values per the verified Google Sheet provided by Fulfillment: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1hDd5fIYKgfVKeb7wrddk5Rt_FIeDJY9xMXEB5Dre21o/edit?usp=sharing
    Recommended approach: controlled data load or script (e.g., Data Loader/ETL or equivalent) with pre/post validation and spot-checks
    Related context: "add on to SSCSF 751" (as stated by requester); Jira comment history references SSCSF-775: https://verifiedfirst.atlassian.net/browse/SSCSF-775

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Product records (Product2) and dependent Fulfillment reporting/dashboards
    No external integrations indicated

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Data mapping prepared and confirmed by https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209381075162523 as correct per comments
    Access to Google Sheet enabled and values verified
    Ready for execution in Sandbox environment
    Post-validation required before Production deployment
    Schedule Production load during low-traffic window to minimize impact

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary
Populate the existing Language field on Salesforce Product records for all current products across posters, kits, manuals, meetings, and MMS. This backfill enables accurate Fulfillment reporting and supports Fulfillment's go-live in Salesforce while ensuring no adverse impact to related objects or reporting.

Value

    Improves operational reporting accuracy for Fulfillment
    Reduces manual workarounds and risk of incorrect shipments/communications
    Supports timely and consistent customer experience for 500+ impacted external customers

Acceptance Criteria

    Language field is populated for existing products in the following categories: posters, kits, manuals, meetings, and MMS.
    No adverse impact to existing relationships, reporting, or other object dependencies.

Technical Requirements

    Data backfill of an existing field; no new fields or schema changes requested.
    
    Execute in Sandbox first; validate results, then promote to Production.
    
    Source-of-truth values per the verified Google Sheet provided by Fulfillment:    -   https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1hDd5fIYKgfVKeb7wrddk5Rt_FIeDJY9xMXEB5Dre21o/edit?usp=sharing
    
    Recommended approach: controlled data load or script (e.g., Data Loader/ETL or equivalent) with pre/post validation and spot-checks.
    
    Related context: "add on to SSCSF 751" (as stated by requester); Jira comment history references SSCSF-775:    -   https://verifiedfirst.atlassian.net/browse/SSCSF-775

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Product records (Product2) and dependent Fulfillment reporting/dashboards
    No external integrations indicated

Triage Notes

    Requestor: Ben Gores (FULF - Fulfillment); Impact: 500+ External Customers; Personal Priority: High
    Purpose: Required for Fulfillment to go live in SF; must not impact other relationships/reporting.
    Status/Readiness: Data mapping was prepared and confirmed by Ben as correct (per comments). Access to the Google Sheet was enabled and values verified.
    Project context: Invoicing Project; Work Type: Data Management; Scope: Routine Work; Lift: 90 min - Small.
    Risk/mitigation: Run in Sandbox, validate counts and random samples per category, confirm that key reports remain accurate, then schedule Production load during a low-traffic window.
    Intake reference form:    -   https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

data.name: [SFDC-577] Add Notify User Field and Standardize Escalation Case Subject
data.notes:
SFDC Description Enrichment Summary

    Summary
    Add a required “Notify User” field to escalation Cases and default the Subject to “ESCALATION.” When an escalation Case is closed, automatically notify the selected user. This drives accountability, visibility, and consistent reporting for Client Success and Sales.
    
    Value or Impact
    Ensures designated stakeholders are notified upon resolution of escalations, reducing missed follow-ups.
    Standardized Subject (“ESCALATION”) improves discoverability in lists, filters, reports, and dashboards across CS and Sales.
    Improves operational consistency on Account-related escalation case management.

3. Acceptance Criteria

    “Notify User” (Lookup to active Users) is visible and required on all escalation Cases in the Account “Cases” layout.
    When Status changes to Closed on an escalation Case, the selected Notify User is automatically notified.
    Subject defaults to “ESCALATION” at creation for escalation Cases and cannot be changed by the user at creation time.
    Verified across roles (CSM, Sales Rep, Manager) that Subject behavior and notifications work as intended.

4. Technical Details

    Field: Create “Notify User” Lookup(User), limited to active users; required for escalation Cases.
    Layout: Place and require on the Case layout used for escalation scenarios surfaced in Account → Cases (related list/detail).
    Subject Default: Set Case.Subject = “ESCALATION” at creation for escalation Cases; prevent edit at creation via Record Type/Layout read-only or validation rule.
    Closure Notification: Record-Triggered Flow (after update) on Case detects Status transition to Closed for escalation Cases; sends Email Alert and/or In-App Notification to Notify User.
    Scope: Applies specifically to escalation Cases associated with Accounts.
    Open Questions:
        How are “escalation Cases” identified (Record Type vs. checkbox/flag)?
        Preferred notification channel (email template and/or in-app)? Provide template content if email is used.
        Should Subject remain controlled post-creation or only locked at creation?

5. Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Case object (fields, record types, page layouts), Account page (Cases related list)
    Salesforce Flow: Record-Triggered Flow on Case
    Notifications: Email Alerts and/or In-App Notifications
    Reporting/Dashboards: Uses Case.Subject and escalation identifier for filtering and KPIs

6. Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Confirm the escalation identifier approach to reliably target defaults/requirements.
    Decide the notification channel(s) and provide/approve email template copy if applicable.
    Clarify whether Subject control is creation-only or should remain restricted after creation.
    Plan UAT with CSM, Sales Rep, and Manager profiles to validate notifications and Subject controls.

7. Original Description Reference
Original description is retained in the task.
Excerpt: “Add a required ‘Notify User’ field to escalation cases and default the Subject to ‘ESCALATION.’ Notify the selected user automatically when an escalation case is closed.”

Title status: Title standardized to: [SFDC-577] Add Notify User Field and Standardize Escalation Case Subject

Lift-based timeline review: Lift = 6h (Large) → heuristic due within 1 week. Current due date Oct 29 2025 appears aligned.

Notes

    Technical content was preserved; placeholders added where information is not provided.
    Ready for R4 – Prioritization+.

data.name: [SFDC-535] Standardize Shipping Country to US
data.notes:
Summary
    The Fulfillment team needs Salesforce to standardize Shipping Address country values to “US” (not “USA”) to prevent shipping label generation errors. Labels fail to generate when “USA” is entered, disrupting daily shipping workflows and causing delays and rework.
    
    Value or Impact
    Prevents label generation failures and reduces manual rework
    Improves data standardization and operational efficiency for Fulfillment
    Reduces shipping delays and improves on-time fulfillment
    Affects daily Fulfillment operations (2–9 users)

3. Acceptance Criteria

    Disallow “USA” as an entry/value for the shipping address country on relevant objects.
    If retroactive updates are in scope and approved, convert existing “USA” values to “US” on applicable records.
    Testing confirms shipping label generation succeeds when country = “US” and fails/blocked/rejected for “USA”.
    Document the chosen enforcement approach (validation vs. picklist vs. flow vs. character limit) and impacted objects/fields.

4. Technical Details

    Enforcement options (to be confirmed in triage):        Validation Rule restricting entry to “US”
        Picklist configuration: remove/disable “USA”; keep “US”
        Before-save Flow or Apex to normalize “USA” → “US” on create/update
        Stakeholder question from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209381075162523: can the field be limited to 2 characters so “USA” cannot be entered?

    Retroactive data correction (if approved): targeted bulk update where country = “USA” → “US”
    Testing considerations:        Verify label generation success for “US”
        Verify attempts to save “USA” are blocked or automatically corrected based on selected approach

    Objects/fields to validate during triage: Account shipping address, Order shipping address, and any related address records
    Related configuration areas: picklist values, validation rules, before-save Flow (if used), and potential Apex

5. Affected Systems

    Salesforce Objects/Pages: Account, Order (shipping address fields)
    Related Configuration: picklist values, validation rules, before-save Flow
    Downstream Process: shipping label generation workflow/system

6. Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Confirm scope of retroactive updates (objects/fields and volume): Accounts, Orders, and any related address records
    Decide preferred enforcement approach (validation rule vs. picklist restriction vs. before-save Flow vs. 2-character limit)
    Align with Fulfillment on timing for any bulk data correction to minimize operational impact
    Coordinate brief UAT with Fulfillment to validate label generation behavior after change
    Impact: Reported by https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209381075162523, affects Fulfillment daily operations; prior notes from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672 indicate enforcement is needed due to user-entered data
    Project linkage per custom field: Invoicing Project
    Lift: Small (~90 minutes) for configuration + light QA; add buffer if bulk fix included

7. Original Description
Summary
The fulfillment team needs Salesforce to standardize the Shipping Address country value to “US” (not “USA”) to prevent shipping label generation errors. Users currently encounter errors when the country is “USA,” impacting shipping workflows.

Value

    Prevents label generation failures and reduces manual rework
    Improves data standardization and operational efficiency for Fulfillment
    Reduces shipping delays and improves on-time fulfillment

Acceptance Criteria

    Disallow “USA” as an option/value for the shipping address country.
    Confirm whether retroactive updates are in scope and, if approved, convert existing “USA” values to “US” on applicable records.

Technical Requirements

    Enforce “US” and prevent “USA” entry via one of the following (to be confirmed in triage):    -   Validation Rule restricting values to “US”        Picklist value restriction (remove/disable “USA”; keep “US”)
        Before-save Flow or Apex to normalize “USA” → “US” on create/update

    Retroactive data correction (if approved): targeted bulk update of existing records where country = “USA” to “US”
    
    Testing: confirm label generation succeeds with “US” and is blocked/rejected for “USA”
    
    Stakeholder question: per https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209381075162523, can we alternatively limit the country field to 2 characters to prevent “USA”?

Affected Systems

    Salesforce objects/pages: Account, Order (shipping address fields)
    Related configuration: picklist values, validation rules, before-save Flow (if used)
    Downstream process: shipping label generation workflow

Triage Notes

    Impact: FULF - Fulfillment; reported by https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209381075162523; affects daily shipping operations (2–9 users)
    
    Prior comments:    -   https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672 noted enforcement is needed since it’s user input        https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209381075162523 suggested limiting the field to 2 characters so “USA” cannot be entered

    Open clarifications needed:    -   Scope of retroactive update (objects/fields: Accounts, Orders, any related address records)        Preferred enforcement approach (validation vs picklist vs before-save Flow vs character limit)

data.name: [SFDC-555] Create State Poster Update Report
data.notes:
Summary
Create a Salesforce report for Fulfillment that lists active poster maintenance contracts and includes LLP State (from Quote Line Item) and NSC Poster Code (from Product). The report must allow filtering by state to support sending state-specific poster updates efficiently.

Value or Impact

    Allows Fulfillment to quickly identify active poster contracts by state.
    Centralizes key data points (contract status, LLP State, NSC Product Code) for daily operations.
    Reduces manual lookup, lowering error risk and improving throughput ahead of invoicing.

Acceptance Criteria

    Users can run a report of active poster maintenance contracts and filter by state using LLP State.
    Report includes at minimum:        Contract Status = Active
        LLP State (from Quote Line Item)
        NSC Product Code (from Product)

    Report is usable by Fulfillment for daily poster update operations.

Technical Details

    Deliverable: Salesforce Report (Custom Report Type or Joined Report) that surfaces:        Contract records (Active only)
        LLP State from related Quote Line Items
        NSC Poster Code from related Product records

    Filters:        Contract Status = Active
        State filter: LLP State

    Security/Visibility: Ensure necessary field-level security and report access for Fulfillment users.
    Implementation notes:        Validate relationships needed to surface QLI and Product fields alongside Contract.
        Confirm exact API names and ensure fields are reportable and visible.


Affected Systems

    Salesforce Reports & Dashboards
    Salesforce Objects/Fields:        Contract (Status)
        Quote Line Item (LLP State)
        Product (NSC Poster Code)

    Permissions:        Reporting access for Fulfillment roles/users.


Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Validate available relationships/fields to expose LLP State (QLI) and NSC Code (Product) with Contract in a single report (may require a Custom Report Type or a Joined Report).
    Confirm field API names and visibility for LLP State and NSC Product Code.
    Build the report and verify filters (Active contracts; State via LLP State).
    UAT with https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209381075162523 and iterate as needed.
    Source intake form reference (for any clarifications): https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

data.name: [SFDC-543] Enable Multiple Shipping Labels on Orders
data.notes:
Summary
Enable the Fulfillment team to create multiple shipping labels for a single order (e.g., multi-box shipments). Users should be able to generate additional labels, each with its own unique tracking number, and specify package details as needed. This supports large orders and reduces manual workarounds prior to Fulfillment go-live.

Value or Impact

    Improves fulfillment efficiency and accuracy for multi-box shipments.
    Enhances customer experience with correct tracking per package.
    Reduces manual steps and potential errors before Fulfillment production go-live.
    Affected users/systems: Fulfillment team; external customers (50–500 impacted).

Acceptance Criteria

    From the Order page, provide an option in the dropdown menu to create an additional shipping label when needed.
    Each additional label:        Generates its own unique tracking number.
        Allows entry of additional shipping details (weight, dimensions) prior to label creation.

    The process clearly differentiates labels and tracking numbers at the order level to avoid confusion during packing and shipment.

Technical Details

    Add a UI control on the Order page to trigger creation of an additional shipping label.
    Provide inputs for additional package information (weight, dimensions) as part of the additional-label creation flow.
    Ensure a unique tracking number is captured for each label created.
    Persist and display label and tracking information associated with the order for fulfillment visibility.
    Leverage the existing shipping label generation process; do not change current single-label behavior unless creating an additional label is requested.
    Dependencies and integrations: (Information not provided. Confirm shipping carrier/integration and storage model for multiple tracking numbers.)

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Order page and related Order data.
    Existing shipping label generation workflow associated with orders.
    Potential integration layer with shipping carrier service(s): (Information not provided.)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Confirm whether this remains needed; https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209381075162523 was asked for relevance on Oct 7, 2025 (status pending).
    Validate carrier/integration specifics (e.g., service used, API flow) and where multiple tracking numbers are stored/displayed.
    Confirm data model updates (fields/related list) to associate multiple labels to a single order.
    Stakeholders: Fulfillment (primary); Cross-functional: TIE - IT & Engineering.
    Risk vectors: Client Experience, Productivity, Technical, Reputational.

data.name: [SFDC-533] Add Contact Email Addresses to Invoice Screen
data.notes:
Name:
Josh Metzger  

Email Address:
josh.metzger@safetyservicescompany.com  

Department Represented:
FIN - Finance & Strategy  

Most Impacted Group:
External Customers  

Impact Scope:
50-500 customers or staff  

Importance to Daily Work:
Medium  

Also Impacted Departments:  

    SALE - Sales  
    TIE - IT & Engineering

Type of Request:
Salesforce  

Salesforce Ticket Type:
SFDC - Feature Request  

Associated Page Type:
Invoice  

Requesting a New Field:
Yes  

Function of New Field:
In the invoice screen, we need the following fields:  

    Contact (authorized purchaser)  
    Contact Email Address  
    Stripe Primary Email  
    Billing Email (from account)

This will result in three email addresses to ensure the correct individual receives the invoice email. While the Stripe Email and Billing Email from the account may be the same, we need to confirm this.  

Associated with Ongoing Salesforce Project:
Invoicing Project  

User Story:
As a finance user, I want to send the invoice to the billing and Stripe contacts as well as the main contact (authorized purchaser) so they all have access to the invoice.  

Acceptance Criteria:
All fields are available on the invoice screen in Salesforce.  

Additional Details Option:
Salesforce  

Request Title:
New Contact Email Addresses Added to Invoice Screen  

Additional Context:
N/A  

----------------------------------------

data.notes:
*Name:*
Josh Metzger
*Email address:*
[josh.metzger@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:[josh.metzger@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:josh.metzger@safetyservicescompany.com]]
*Which Department are you representing?:*
FIN - Finance & Strategy
*Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:*
Entire Department or Team
*How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:*
10-49
*How important is this to your daily work?:*
Medium
*Select any department that is also impacted.:*
SALE - Sales
TIE - IT & Engineering
*What type of request is this?:*
Salesforce
*What kind of Salesforce Ticket is this?:*
SFDC - Bug
*What is the expected result?:*
Ability to check "distressed" and "Payment Plan Invoice" after it has been posted
*What is preventing this result?:*
Rules that items on the invoice cannot be changed once it is posted.
*Is this request associated with an ongoing Salesforce Project?:*
Invoicing Project
*User Story:*
As a finance user, I should be able to check the distressed box and payment plan invoice box after the invoice has been posted.  There are many times we do not put someone on payment plan until after the invoice has been sent.  Distressed status only happens after an invoice has been posted.
*Acceptance Criteria:*
Ability to check the box after it has been posted if in a finance or admin role in SFDC.
*Select an option that will give us additional details:*
Salesforce
*What should we call this?:*
Distressed and Payment Plan check boxes unavailable when invoice posted
*Additional Context:*
See screen shot attached.

data.name: [SFDC-534] Configure Google Ads Email Tracking Integration
data.notes:
*Name:*
Lora Duran
*Email address:*
[lora.duran@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:[lora.duran@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:lora.duran@safetyservicescompany.com]]
*Which Department are you representing?:*
MKTG - Marketing & Knowledge
*What kind of Impact is this having?:*
Inconvenience
*What type of request is this?:*
Salesforce
*What kind of Salesforce Ticket is this?:*
Support
*Is this request associated with an ongoing Salesforce Project?:*
No, this is general
*User Story:*
As a paid ad specialist, I want Salesforce to give Google Ads data for the entire customer journey (MQL > SQL > Closed/Won Op) so I can track the revenue per lead. 
*Acceptance Criteria:*
Salesforce > settings > object Manager > search "Opportunity" > Fields and Relationships > New > "Email". 
Once created, go to Set History Tracking > checkmark "Email" 
I can then allow Google Ads to use the mapping to track back 
*What should we call this?:*
Google Ads Field Mapping Request
*Additional Context:*
The email under "Leads" should be the same email under "Opportunity" so it can track the customer journey from the start of a form fill. In other words, I want to track the email the customer initially gives through the end. 
———————————————

data.name: [SFDC-560] Fix Tax Calculation on Discounted Invoices
data.notes:
*Name:*
Josh Metzger
*Email address:*
[josh.metzger@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:[josh.metzger@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:josh.metzger@safetyservicescompany.com]]
*Which Department are you representing?:*
FIN - Finance & Strategy
*Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:*
External Customers
*How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:*
500+
*How important is this to your daily work?:*
High
*Select any department that is also impacted.:*
SALE - Sales
TIE - IT & Engineering
*What type of request is this?:*
Salesforce
*What kind of Salesforce Ticket is this?:*
SFDC - Bug
*What is the expected result?:*
Tax amount should be calculated based on the line item total in the invoice after the discount.  It appears to be calculating off the amount before the discount.
*What is preventing this result?:*
Assuming our tax calculation rules are set to drive off the wrong amount. 
*Is this request associated with an ongoing Salesforce Project?:*
Invoicing Project
*User Story:*
As a customer, I would expect the tax amount to be calculated off the net amount of each line (after discount) but it does not appear to be doing this, thus increasing the taxes that customer owes and we would owe as a company. 
*Acceptance Criteria:*
Tax gets calculated accurately based on after discount amount. 
*Select an option that will give us additional details:*
Salesforce
*What should we call this?:*
Tax Amount Incorrectly Calculated
*Additional Context:*
n/a
———————————————

data.name: [SFDC-575] Require Stripe Email Contact Fields for Sales Stages
data.notes:
Name:
Justin Bilodeau

Email address:
justin.bilodeau@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
FIN - Finance & Strategy

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Entire Company

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
500+

How important is this to your daily work?:
High

Select any department that is also impacted.:
BOPS - Business Operations
CUST - Client Success
DATA - Data Intelligence
FIN - Finance
SALE - Sales
STRG - Strategic Growth

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Feature Request

Related Page / Object:
Account Object

Feature Description:
Stripe Primary Email and Contact field on the account object need to editable by all users, visible on all page layouts and required fields to change an opportunity stage to 'Sale Pending' or 'Closed/Won'

Business Priority & Sprint Target:
High business priority to prevent accumulation of accounts being created without these required fields as needed for finance migration. Include in soonest sprint possible

User Story:
As a Salesforce user I want to be able to view and edit the Stripe Primary Email field and Contact field and if fields equal NULL not allow new opportunities to have stage changed to Sale Pending or Closed/Won

Acceptance Criteria:
Stripe Primary email field on Account object should be visible on all page layouts
Stripe Primary email field on Account object should be editable to all users with no restrictions
Contact field on Account object should be visible on all page layouts
Contact field on Account object should be editable to all users with no restrictions
For any open opportunities when stage is attempted to move from any stage to Sale Pending or Closed/Won and EITHER Contact field or Stripe Primary Email field equals NULL should generate error that fields need to be completed to update opportunity stage
For any open opportunities when stage is attempted to move to any stage except Sale Pending or Closed/Won and EITHER Contact field or Stripe Primary Email field equals NULL no error should generate
For any open opportunities when stage is attempted to move from any stage to Sale Pending or Closed/Won and BOTH Contact field and Stripe Primary Email field not equal to NULL no error should generate


What should we call this?:
Stripe Primary Email/Contact Field Requirement

Additional Context:
Needed as part of invoicing migration project

———————————————
This task was submitted through Technical Integration & Engineering Ticket Form
https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

data.notes:
Name:
Josh Metzger

Email address:
josh.metzger@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
FIN - Finance & Strategy

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
External Customers

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
500+

How important is this to your daily work?:
Critical

Select any department that is also impacted.:
SALE - Sales
TIE - IT & Engineering

What type of request is this?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce Ticket is this?:
SFDC - Feature Request

What type of page is associated with this feature?:
Stripe Portal

Are you requesting a new field?:
Yes

What is the function of this new field?:
We need the Stripe Portal to have two ways for a customer to make payment. 

1. Sign in with customer ID and password (that they create).


Is this request associated with an ongoing Salesforce Project?:
Invoicing Project

User Story:
As a customer, I need a secure portal that I can save my payment information in if i wish.  Having an authentication code that is sent via email and on an invoice that is included in the packing slip when shipped is not secure at all.  We will run into issues with this and customers will not like this.

Acceptance Criteria:
Need one secure sign in with password.. 

Select an option that will give us additional details:
Salesforce

What should we call this?:
Stripe Portal Login Options

Additional Context:
Attached screen shots from ebill for reference.

data.name: [SFDC-576] Configure Mandatory Fields for Escalation Cases
data.notes:
Name:
Leslie Onley  

Email Address:
leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com  

Department Represented:
CUST - Client Success  

Impact of Issue:  

    Who is MOST impacted by this issue?
    Multiple People  
    How many customers or staff does this issue impact?
    10-49  
    How important is this to your daily work?
    Critical

Additional Departments Impacted:  

    CUST - Client Success  
    SALE - Sales  
    STRG - Strategic Growth

Assistance Requested:
IT Core  

Type of IT Issue:
Feature / Enhancement  

Description of Change:
We need to update the Salesforce Case configuration to require specific fields when submitting an Escalation, regardless of how the Case is created. This applies to both:  

    Submissions through the Cases Quick Link  
    Submissions via the New Case option from the Account page dropdown

The following fields must be set as mandatory for all new Escalation Cases:  

    Issue  
    Description  
    Client Feedback  
    Contact Name  
    Priority

This ensures all escalations are submitted with the necessary information, regardless of the submission method.  

User Story:
As a Case Submitter, I want the required fields (Issue, Description, Client Feedback, Contact Name, Priority) enforced across all Escalation Case submissions, so that escalations contain consistent and complete details, no matter where they are created in Salesforce.  

Success Criteria:
Mandatory fields apply to Escalation Cases created via:  

    Cases Quick Links  
    Account Page Dropdown – New Case option

Users cannot save or submit an Escalation Case unless the fields listed above are populated. Other Case types or processes remain unchanged. A separate IT ticket has already been submitted to auto-populate "ESCALATION" in the Subject line for these cases. This ensures complete and standardized escalation submissions across all entry points.  

Problem Description:
Hardware or Software Configuration  

Device / App & Version:
Salesforce  

Configuration Needed:
Tweak Settings  

Purpose or Context:
This change supports the transition of all client escalations to Salesforce Cases, replacing legacy Smartsheet tracking. Requiring these fields on all Escalation submissions—regardless of how they are created—ensures consistency, improves data quality, and allows managers to properly triage and resolve escalations without delays or missing information.  

Task Title:
Escalation Case Mandatory Field Additions  

Additional Context:
N/A  

----------------------------------------

This task was submitted through the Technical Integration & Engineering Ticket Form
https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

subtasks.name: [SFDC-649] Set up automated email notifications for new Escalation Cases
subtasks.notes:
Name:
Leslie Onley

Email address:
leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
CUST - Client Success

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Multiple People

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
10-49

How important is this to your daily work?:
Critical

Select any department that is also impacted.:
CUST - Client Success
SALE - Sales
STRG - Strategic Growth

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Feature Request

Related Page / Object:
Salesforce → Case Object → Escalation Case (created via Account page or “Cases” quick link)

Feature Description:
We need Salesforce to automatically notify the CSM Leadership Team via email whenever a new Escalation Case is created. The email distribution list to be notified is:
CSM Leadership Team CSMLeadershipTeam@safetyservicescompany.com

Members of this distro include:
Janel Brugier, Donald Pelletier, Leslie Onley, Justin Bilodeau, Jessica Messersmith, Julia Taylor, and Matt Lincoln.

Note: A separate ticket is already in place to route these cases into the proper queue. We are unsure if Salesforce can send email notifications to a distribution list when a case is submitted, and would like IT to confirm and implement if possible.

Business Priority & Sprint Target:
Escalation cases are time-sensitive and critical to client satisfaction. We are requesting this feature be included in the next sprint, or at the latest, the one immediately following.

User Story:
As a CSM Leader and executive leadership, We want to be automatically notified by email when an Escalation Case is submitted in Salesforce, so that the leadership team can promptly review and take action on urgent client issues and/or have visibility on cases that are coming in. 

Acceptance Criteria:
When an Escalation Case is submitted (via Account page or Cases quick link), an automated email notification is sent to the CSM Leadership Team distribution list.

Email includes key case details (e.g., account name, case number, subject, and priority).

Functionality is tested and verified in a sandbox before production deployment.

Confirmation is received from leadership that email notifications are working as expected.

The setup does not interfere with existing workflows or create duplicate alerts.

What should we call this?:
Escalation Case notification email

Additional Context:
Escalation cases represent high-priority client concerns that must be addressed immediately. Prompt visibility by the leadership team is critical to delivering top-tier service and preventing churn. Please confirm Salesforce capability for this type of notification and advise if a custom workflow is needed.



———————————————
This task was submitted through Technical Integration & Engineering Ticket Form
https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

subtasks.name: [SFDC-597] Implement Shared Escalation Queue
subtasks.notes:
Name:
Leslie Onley

Email address:
leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
CUST - Client Success

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Entire Department or Team

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
50-500

How important is this to your daily work?:
Critical

Select any department that is also impacted.:
CUST - Client Success
SALE - Sales
STRG - Strategic Growth

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Feature Request

Related Page / Object:
Account page and cases page 

Feature Description:
Request to have all incoming escalations routed to a shared queue rather than being assigned to one individual. The queue should be visible to Justin, Janel, Donnie, and Leslie so each person can triage and action escalations based on which CSM the issue pertains to.

Business Priority & Sprint Target:
High Priority escalations are a top priority for this department. This will improve workflow efficiency and prevent bottlenecks in escalation handling. We would like to see this included in the upcoming sprint if possible.

User Story:
As a Manager I want all escalations assigned to a shared queue, so that multiple team members (Justin, Janel, Donnie, Leslie) can view and action them, ensuring faster response times and better workload distribution.

Acceptance Criteria:
All escalations are routed to a centralized queue

The queue is accessible to Justin, Janel, Donnie, and Leslie

Team members can clearly identify escalations related to their assigned CSMs

Each person can take ownership of escalations directly from the queue

No escalations default to an individual unless manually assigned



What should we call this?:
Shared Escalation Queue Implementation

Additional Context:
There are currently other escalations tickets pending completion also if we can get them all on the next sprint that would be helpful to implement this process ASAP

———————————————

data.name: [SFDC-568] Update Cancel Case Picklist Values
data.notes:
Name:
Leslie Onley  

Email Address:
leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com  

Department Represented:
CUST - Client Success  

Most Impacted by This Issue:
Entire Department or Team  

Number of Customers or Staff Impacted:
10-49  

Importance to Daily Work:
High  

Also Impacted Departments:  

    CUST - Client Success  
    FIN - Finance  
    SALE - Sales

How Can We Help You Today?
Salesforce  

Type of Salesforce Request:
SFDC - Admin Support  

Configuration Request:
We would like to request updates to existing dropdown (picklist) fields on the Cancel Case layout in Salesforce. This includes adding new values to existing picklists used for tracking cancellations.

    Field: Cancel Category
    Please add the following new values:  
    
        Changing invoice terms  
        Lost hiring client  
        Lost to competitor  
        In-house  
        Changing delivery type (Hardcopy to Digital)  
        Re-invoice
    Field: Cancel Resolution Disposition
    Please add the following new value:  
    
        Re-invoice
    Field: Status
    Please add the following new value:  
    
        Pending Save Attempt

Target Users & Environment:
Users/Profiles:
This change should be available to all users who manage or process Cancellation Cases, including:  

    CSMs  
    Sales  
    Collections team  
    Finance

Environment:
Please implement and test the changes in Sandbox first. Once verified, deploy to Production.  

Urgency & Timing:
It can wait until the next release window.  

User Story:
I want updated and expanded picklist values for Cancel Category, Cancel Resolution Disposition, and Status fields so that I can accurately document the reason and outcome of cancellations, improving reporting, visibility, and client save strategies.  

Acceptance Criteria:  

    The following values are added to the Cancel Category picklist on Cancel Case records:  
        Changing invoice terms  
        Lost hiring client  
        Lost to competitor  
        In-house  
        Changing delivery type (Hardcopy to Digital)  
        Re-invoice
    The following value is added to the Cancel Resolution Disposition picklist:  
        Re-invoice
    The following value is added to the Status picklist:  
        Pending Save Attempt
    All new picklist values are visible to and selectable by users who manage Cancellation Cases.

What Should We Call This?
Updating Cancel Case Category Fields  

Additional Context:
Currently, cancellation cases can be submitted through two different paths:  

    From the Opportunity record  
    From the Account page via the "Cases" quick link

Each path presents a slightly different Cancellation form layout. Please ensure that the updated picklist values (Cancel Category, Cancel Resolution Disposition, and Status) are reflected in both forms, regardless of how the cancellation case is initiated. This will help standardize data capture and prevent discrepancies based on the submission method.  

———————————————

[https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429]

data.name: [SFDC-571] Resolve RingSense Dialing Connectivity Issue
data.notes:
*Name:*
Sarah M DiStefano
*Email address:*
[sarah.distefano@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:[sarah.distefano@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:sarah.distefano@safetyservicescompany.com]]
*Which Department are you representing?:*
SALE - Sales
*Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:*
Just Me
*How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:*
500+
*How important is this to your daily work?:*
Critical
*Select any department that is also impacted.:*
CUST - Client Success
FIN - Finance
FULF - Fulfillment
SALE - Sales
*How can we help you today?:*
Salesforce
*What kind of Salesforce request is this?:*
SFDC - Bug
*Steps to Reproduce:*
RingSense kicked me off a call and now I cant dial out.
*Expected vs Actual Behavior:*
Cannot make the calls from accounts
*Rate the Severity:*
10 out of 10
*User Story:*
I was calling, got cut off and now I cant dial out. When I went to the settings in RingSense it kept glitching off of the settings screen. When it finally did stay it still didnt work. 
*Acceptance Criteria:*
I need to dial out of SalesForce
*What should we call this?:*
Unable to call
*Additional Context:*
RingSense just dialed out a very delayed click to dial call An account I was trying to call before I started to fill out this form.

data.name: [SFDC-547] Add DC option and make poster state optional for federal posters
data.notes:
Name:
Ben Gores  

Email Address:
ben.gores@safetyservicescompany.com  

Department Represented:
FULF - Fulfillment  

Most Impacted By This Issue:
External Customers  

Number of Customers or Staff Impacted:
500+  

Importance to Daily Work:
High  

Other Impacted Departments:  

    FULF - Fulfillment  
    SALE - Sales

How Can We Help You Today?
Salesforce  

Type of Salesforce Request:
SFDC - Bug  

Steps to Reproduce:
When entering a sale, the "Poster State" is a required field. There are two issues:  

    Washington DC is not an option to choose.  
    The poster state is still required when it is a "federal only" poster. Federal only posters should not require the "Poster State" to be completed.

Expected vs Actual Behavior:
3. Washington DC should be an option.
4. Federal only posters should not require a poster state.  

Rate the Severity:
Important  

User Story:
As a sales agent, I need to be able to select Washington DC as a state. I also need to be able to close a sale for federal only posters without choosing a poster state.  

Acceptance Criteria:  

    DC is added as a category to the Poster State.  
    Federal only posters can be submitted without completing the poster state field.

What Should We Call This?
Federal Poster / DC Poster Issues  

Additional Context:
This is needed before invoicing goes live in SF.  

———————————————
This task was submitted through the Technical Integration & Engineering Ticket Form
https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

data.name: [SFDC-572] Create client-facing authentication email template
data.notes:
*Name:*
Daniel DeZago
*Email address:*
[dan.dezago@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:[dan.dezago@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:dan.dezago@safetyservicescompany.com]]
*Which Department are you representing?:*
TIE - Technology Integration & Engineering
*Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:*
External Customers
*How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:*
500+
*How important is this to your daily work?:*
High
*Select any department that is also impacted.:*
BOPS - Business Operations
FIN - Finance
MKTG - Marketing & Knowledge
*How can we help you today?:*
Salesforce
*What kind of Salesforce request is this?:*
SFDC - Feature Request
*Related Page / Object:*
System Email Template
*Feature Description:*
We need to create the template for the email that is going out to our customers related to the authentication code.
*Business Priority & Sprint Target:*
This is of utmost importance. Ideally, it gets done today.
*User Story:*
As a person involved in this project I want a template created so that we can email 8000+ people.
*Acceptance Criteria:*
This does NOT need to include any sort of personalization at the top. It does need to include some basic reference to the other FAQs and ideally a link to the chatbot. It should include the four digit authentication code.
*What should we call this?:*
Create Template for Client-Facing Email
*Additional Context:*
This should be a team lift between Sitara, Kayla, Josh and then final approval from Matt Lincoln.
———————————————
